intro: Homalium dewevrei, commonly known as the African star fruit tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellow-orange fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor, similar to that of the common star fruit. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
